body:
Comment 1: 
Consider for example some method

    Foo(opts Options)

Let's say some implementation of Foo does not and/or cannot use any options - for
whatever reason not anticipated by the interface designer. Now the 'opts' can be ignored
in such case. With your proposal it would, in the first approximation, not be possible
anymore.

Also, this change would break the Go 1 backward compatibility promise.

#WorkingAsIntended
